192420-d-07-23-05-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 2-295-21 PROCEEDING ON MAIN TRACK THROUGH BARRETT DERAILED 16 LOADED GONDOLA CARS CARRYING COILED STEEL, 70 CARS FROM THE ENGINE. 3 CARS ON THEIR SIDE, 13 UPRIGHT. DERAILED CARS CONTACTED UNOCCUPIED LOCOMOTIVES STANDING ON ADJACENT "BACK TRACK" AT BARRETT CAUSING MINIMAL DAMAGE TO CP 6046 & CP5943.  DETERMINED THAT A PIN LIFTER ROD FELL OFF NOKL 64 FROM TRAIN 496-21 WHICH PASSED THROUGH EARLIER IN THE DAY.  INSPECTION FOUND PIN LIFTER WEDGED INTO AND SPREAD THE SWITCH POINT 1 INCH ON THEEAST FORMER SIDING SWITCH AT BARRETT. PRIMARY CAUSE E39C - OTHER COUPLER AND DRAFT SYSTEM DEFECTS, (CAR) ASSOCIATED WITH NOKL 64 ON TRAIN 496-21 PASSING THROUGH EARLIER IN THE DAY AND FOUND TO BE MISSING UPON INSPECTION. SECONDARY CAUSE T319 - AFTER PIN LIFTER FAILED, IT WAS FORCED BETWEEN THE STOCKRAIL AND SWITCH POINT DURING THE REMAINDER OF EASTBOUND MOVMENT OF 496-21. AS THE PIN LIFTER WAS FORCED BETWEEN THE STOCK RAIL AND SWITCH POINT, THE SWITCH POINT BECAME GAPPED BY A DISTANCE EQUAL TOTHE DIAMETER OF THE PIN LIFTER ROD, OR APPROXIMATELY 1-INCH.

2005132-d-07-31-05-DME.Contributing Accident Cause: Train outside yard limits in non block territory, excessive speed
2005132-d-07-31-05-DME.Narrative: DM&E TRAIN MHURC31 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND WITH 3 LOADS, 48 EMPTIES, 1834 TONS.  THEY WERE TRAVELING38 MPH ON A -.60 PERCENT GRADE IN A COMPOUND CURVE THAT WENT FROM A 2 DEGREE TO A 3.05 DEGREE CURVEAND AT THIS TRANSITION POINT WE HAD A PRESSURE KINK.  THE FIELD INSPECTION INDICATED THAT THIS AREAHAD TIGHT STEEL, ANCHOR AND TIE MOVEMENT ALONG WITH INADEQUATE BALLAST SECTION.  THIS TRACK HAD A NORMAL INSPECTION ON JULY 26 AND A HOT WEATHER INSPECTION ON JULY 30.  NEITHER INSPECTION HAD AN EXCEPTION TAKEN AT THIS LOCATION. THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO THE CREW.  THEY WERE DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED WITH NEGATIVE RESULTS.

2005210-d-07-22-05-ICE.Narrative: RUN 29 HAD BEEN SWITCHING A CUT OF 31 CARS ON THE WEST END OF KNOCHE YARD.  THE PIN PULLER (SWITCHMAN) HAD SWITCHED 8 CARS AND LINED THE LEAD TO PUT 2 CARS INTO #4 RAIL, BUT FAILED TO CHECK THE CROSSOVER SWITCHES FROM #4 TO #2, WHICH RESULTED IN THE TWO TANK CARS PROCEEDING THROUGH THE CROSSOVERS AND INTO THE SIDE OF #2 RAIL.  #3 RAIL HAD BEEN BLUE FLAGGED AND THE CROSSOVER SWITCH WAS LINED AND LOCKED INTO THE SIDE OF A STANDING TRAIN IN #2 RAIL, WHICH ADDED TO THE INCIDENT.  CREW MEMBER WAS DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED WITH NO POSITIVES.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.
